verses.verse: When thou sittest <S%H3427><s%> to eat <S%H3898><s%> with a ruler <S%H4910><s%>, consider <S%H995><s%> diligently <S%H995><s%> what is before <S%H6440><s%> thee:
And put <S%H7760><s%> a knife <S%H7915><s%> to thy throat <S%H3930><s%>, if thou be a man given <S%H1167><s%> to appetite <S%H5315><s%>.
Be not desirous <S%H183><s%> of his dainties <S%H4303><s%>: for they are deceitful <S%H3577><s%> meat <S%H3899><s%>.
Labour <S%H3021><s%> not to be rich <S%H6238><s%>: cease <S%H2308><s%> from thine own wisdom <S%H998><s%>.

Wilt thou set <S%H5774><s%> <S%H5774><s%> thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> upon that which is not? for riches certainly <S%H6213><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> themselves wings <S%H3671><s%>; they fly away <S%H5774><s%> <S%H5774><s%> as an eagle <S%H5404><s%> toward heaven <S%H8064><s%>. set: Heb. cause thine eyes to fly upon
Eat <S%H3898><s%> thou not the bread <S%H3899><s%> of him that hath an evil <S%H7451><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%>, neither desire <S%H183><s%> thou his dainty meats <S%H4303><s%>:
For as he thinketh <S%H8176><s%> in his heart <S%H5315><s%>, so is he: Eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%>, saith <S%H559><s%> he to thee; but his heart <S%H3820><s%> is not with thee.
The morsel <S%H6595><s%> which thou hast eaten <S%H398><s%> shalt thou vomit up <S%H6958><s%>, and lose <S%H7843><s%> thy sweet <S%H5273><s%> words <S%H1697><s%>.
Speak <S%H1696><s%> not in the ears <S%H241><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%>: for he will despise <S%H936><s%> the wisdom <S%H7922><s%> of thy words <S%H4405><s%>.
Remove <S%H5253><s%> not the old <S%H5769><s%> landmark <S%H1366><s%>; and enter <S%H935><s%> not into the fields <S%H7704><s%> of the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>: landmark: or, bound
For their redeemer <S%H1350><s%> is mighty <S%H2389><s%>; he shall plead <S%H7378><s%> their cause <S%H7379><s%> with thee.
Apply <S%H935><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> unto instruction <S%H4148><s%>, and thine ears <S%H241><s%> to the words <S%H561><s%> of knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.
Withhold <S%H4513><s%> not correction <S%H4148><s%> from the child <S%H5288><s%>: for if thou beatest <S%H5221><s%> him with the rod <S%H7626><s%>, he shall not die <S%H4191><s%>.
Thou shalt beat <S%H5221><s%> him with the rod <S%H7626><s%>, and shalt deliver <S%H5337><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from hell <S%H7585><s%>.
My son <S%H1121><s%>, if thine heart <S%H3820><s%> be wise <S%H2449><s%>, my heart <S%H3820><s%> shall rejoice <S%H8055><s%>, even mine <S%H589><s%>. even: or, even I will rejoice
Yea, my reins <S%H3629><s%> shall rejoice <S%H5937><s%>, when thy lips <S%H8193><s%> speak <S%H1696><s%> right things <S%H4339><s%>.
Let not thine heart <S%H3820><s%> envy <S%H7065><s%> sinners <S%H2400><s%>: but be thou in the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> all the day <S%H3117><s%> long.
For surely there is <S%H3426><s%> an end <S%H319><s%>; and thine expectation <S%H8615><s%> shall not be cut off <S%H3772><s%>. end: or, reward
Hear <S%H8085><s%> thou, my son <S%H1121><s%>, and be wise <S%H2449><s%>, and guide <S%H833><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%>.
Be not among winebibbers <S%H3196><s%> <S%H5433><s%>; among riotous eaters <S%H2151><s%> of flesh <S%H1320><s%>: of flesh: Heb. of their flesh
For the drunkard <S%H5433><s%> and the glutton <S%H2151><s%> shall come to poverty <S%H3423><s%>: and drowsiness <S%H5124><s%> shall clothe <S%H3847><s%> a man with rags <S%H7168><s%>.
Hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto thy father <S%H1><s%> that begat <S%H3205><s%> thee, and despise <S%H936><s%> not thy mother <S%H517><s%> when she is old <S%H2204><s%>.
Buy <S%H7069><s%> the truth <S%H571><s%>, and sell <S%H4376><s%> it not; also wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and instruction <S%H4148><s%>, and understanding <S%H998><s%>.

The father <S%H1><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall greatly <S%H1524><s%> rejoice <S%H1523><s%>: and he that begetteth <S%H3205><s%> a wise <S%H2450><s%> child shall have joy <S%H8055><s%> of him.
Thy father <S%H1><s%> and thy mother <S%H517><s%> shall be glad <S%H8055><s%>, and she that bare <S%H3205><s%> thee shall rejoice <S%H1523><s%>.
My son <S%H1121><s%>, give <S%H5414><s%> me thine heart <S%H3820><s%>, and let thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> observe <S%H7521><s%> <S%H5341><s%> my ways <S%H1870><s%>.
For a whore <S%H2181><s%> is a deep <S%H6013><s%> ditch <S%H7745><s%>; and a strange woman <S%H5237><s%> is a narrow <S%H6862><s%> pit <S%H875><s%>.
She also lieth in wait <S%H693><s%> as for a prey <S%H2863><s%>, and increaseth <S%H3254><s%> the transgressors <S%H898><s%> among men <S%H120><s%>. as for: or, as a robber

Who hath woe <S%H188><s%>? who hath sorrow <S%H17><s%>? who hath contentions <S%H4079><s%> <S%H4066><s%>? who hath babbling <S%H7879><s%>? who hath wounds <S%H6482><s%> without cause <S%H2600><s%>? who hath redness <S%H2448><s%> of eyes <S%H5869><s%>?
They that tarry long <S%H309><s%> at the wine <S%H3196><s%>; they that go <S%H935><s%> to seek <S%H2713><s%> mixed wine <S%H4469><s%>.

Look <S%H7200><s%> not thou upon the wine <S%H3196><s%> when it is red <S%H119><s%>, when it giveth <S%H5414><s%> his colour <S%H5869><s%> in the cup <S%H3563><s%> <S%H3599><s%>, when it moveth <S%H1980><s%> itself aright <S%H4339><s%>.
At the last <S%H319><s%> it biteth <S%H5391><s%> like a serpent <S%H5175><s%>, and stingeth <S%H6567><s%> like an adder <S%H6848><s%>. an: or, a cockatrice
Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> strange women <S%H2114><s%>, and thine heart <S%H3820><s%> shall utter <S%H1696><s%> perverse things <S%H8419><s%>.

Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down <S%H7901><s%> in the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>, or as he that lieth <S%H7901><s%> upon the top <S%H7218><s%> of a mast <S%H2260><s%>. the midst: Heb. the heart of the sea

They have stricken <S%H5221><s%> me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick <S%H2470><s%>; they have beaten <S%H1986><s%> me, and I felt <S%H3045><s%> it not: when shall I awake <S%H6974><s%>? I will seek <S%H1245><s%> it yet <S%H3254><s%> again. I felt: Heb. I knew it not
